messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Full path
- /api/articles/{slug}/favorite

All methods allowed?
- No

Allowed HTTP methods for this path (based on the code)
- HEAD: No
- POST: Yes (registered: router.POST("/:slug/favorite", ArticleFavorite))
- OPTIONS: No
- TRACE: No
- GET: No
- PUT: No
- DELETE: Yes (registered: router.DELETE("/:slug/favorite", ArticleUnfavorite))
- PATCH: No

Explanation
- In main (hello.go) a router group v1 is created with r.Group("/api"). ArticlesRegister is attached to v1.Group("/articles") (after calling v1.Use(users.AuthMiddleware(true))). That yields the full base path /api/articles for the routes defined in ArticlesRegister.
- In articles/routers.go ArticlesRegister registers the two routes for the favorite path:
  - router.POST("/:slug/favorite", ArticleFavorite)
  - router.DELETE("/:slug/favorite", ArticleUnfavorite)
  These create the concrete endpoints /api/articles/{slug}/favorite for POST and DELETE.
- No other methods (HEAD, GET, PUT, PATCH, OPTIONS, TRACE, etc.) are registered in the source for that path, so they are not acceptable according to the code. (Middleware/auth does not implicitly register additional HTTP methods.)
